intro: Campanuloides, commonly known as the bell-shaped flower plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped or tubular flowers, which are often blue or violet in color. These plants typically have opposite or whorled leaves and are often found in temperate regions. Campanuloides species are known for their ornamental value and are commonly cultivated in gardens. They prefer well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight.
